container-title: She was born in Boston and was educated at the School of the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. After teaching art in Cleveland for several years, she moved to Washington, D.C. around 1896. She rearranged the East Room at the White House for Mrs. Grover Cleveland and worked on the interior decoration of the president’s home in Princeton.
